intro: Cornutia pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed cornutia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in spring. Cornutia pentaphylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
